description: Smart Chains, Smarter Conversations. (Converted from Langflow Store for AxieStudio compatibility)

code.value:
from pydantic.v1 import SecretStr

from axiestudio.base.models.model import LCModelComponent
from axiestudio.field_typing import LanguageModel
from axiestudio.inputs import DropdownInput, FloatInput, IntInput, SecretStrInput


class GoogleGenerativeAIComponent(LCModelComponent):
    display_name = "Google Generative AI"
    description = "Generate text using Google Generative AI."
    icon = "GoogleGenerativeAI"
    name = "GoogleGenerativeAIModel"

    inputs = LCModelComponent._base_inputs + [
        IntInput(
            name="max_output_tokens",
            display_name="Max Output Tokens",
            info="The maximum number of tokens to generate.",
        ),
        DropdownInput(
            name="model",
            display_name="Model",
            info="The name of the model to use.",
            options=["gemini-1.5-pro", "gemini-1.5-flash", "gemini-1.0-pro", "gemini-1.0-pro-vision"],
            value="gemini-1.5-pro",
        ),
        SecretStrInput(
            name="google_api_key",
            display_name="Google API Key",
            info="The Google API Key to use for the Google Generative AI.",
        ),
        FloatInput(
            name="top_p",
            display_name="Top P",
            info="The maximum cumulative probability of tokens to consider when sampling.",
            advanced=True,
        ),
        FloatInput(name="temperature", display_name="Temperature", value=0.1),
        IntInput(
            name="n",
            display_name="N",
            info="Number of chat completions to generate for each prompt. Note that the API may not return the full n completions if duplicates are generated.",
            advanced=True,
        ),
        IntInput(
            name="top_k",
            display_name="Top K",
            info="Decode using top-k sampling: consider the set of top_k most probable tokens. Must be positive.",
            advanced=True,
        ),
    ]

    def build_model(self) -> LanguageModel:  # type: ignore[type-var]
        try:
            from langchain_google_genai import ChatGoogleGenerativeAI
        except ImportError:
            raise ImportError("The 'langchain_google_genai' package is required to use the Google Generative AI model.")

        google_api_key = self.google_api_key
        model = self.model
        max_output_tokens = self.max_output_tokens
        temperature = self.temperature
        top_k = self.top_k
        top_p = self.top_p
        n = self.n

        output = ChatGoogleGenerativeAI(  # type: ignore
            model=model,
            max_output_tokens=max_output_tokens or None,
            temperature=temperature,
            top_k=top_k or None,
            top_p=top_p or None,
            n=n or 1,
            google_api_key=SecretStr(google_api_key),
        )

        return output  # type: ignore
code.name: code

google_api_key.name: google_api_key
google_api_key.info: The Google API Key to use for the Google Generative AI.

max_output_tokens.name: max_output_tokens
max_output_tokens.info: The maximum number of tokens to generate.

model.name: model
model.info: The name of the model to use.

n.name: n
n.info: Number of chat completions to generate for each prompt. Note that the API may not return the full n completions if duplicates are generated.

stream.name: stream
stream.info: Stream the response from the model. Streaming works only in Chat.

system_message.name: system_message
system_message.info: System message to pass to the model.

top_k.name: top_k
top_k.info: Decode using top-k sampling: consider the set of top_k most probable tokens. Must be positive.

top_p.name: top_p
top_p.info: The maximum cumulative probability of tokens to consider when sampling.

node.description: Generate text using Google Generative AI.

code.value:
from axiestudio.base.io.chat import ChatComponent
from axiestudio.inputs import BoolInput
from axiestudio.io import DropdownInput, MessageTextInput, Output
from axiestudio.memory import store_message
from axiestudio.schema.message import Message
from axiestudio.utils.constants import MESSAGE_SENDER_AI, MESSAGE_SENDER_NAME_AI, MESSAGE_SENDER_USER


class ChatOutput(ChatComponent):
    display_name = "Chat Output"
    description = "Display a chat message in the Playground."
    icon = "ChatOutput"
    name = "ChatOutput"

    inputs = [
        MessageTextInput(
            name="input_value",
            display_name="Text",
            info="Message to be passed as output.",
        ),
        BoolInput(
            name="should_store_message",
            display_name="Store Messages",
            info="Store the message in the history.",
            value=True,
            advanced=True,
        ),
        DropdownInput(
            name="sender",
            display_name="Sender Type",
            options=[MESSAGE_SENDER_AI, MESSAGE_SENDER_USER],
            value=MESSAGE_SENDER_AI,
            advanced=True,
            info="Type of sender.",
        ),
        MessageTextInput(
            name="sender_name",
            display_name="Sender Name",
            info="Name of the sender.",
            value=MESSAGE_SENDER_NAME_AI,
            advanced=True,
        ),
        MessageTextInput(
            name="session_id",
            display_name="Session ID",
            info="The session ID of the chat. If empty, the current session ID parameter will be used.",
            advanced=True,
        ),
        MessageTextInput(
            name="data_template",
            display_name="Data Template",
            value="{text}",
            advanced=True,
            info="Template to convert Data to Text. If left empty, it will be dynamically set to the Data's text key.",
        ),
    ]
    outputs = [
        Output(display_name="Message", name="message", method="message_response"),
    ]

    def message_response(self) -> Message:
        message = Message(
            text=self.input_value,
            sender=self.sender,
            sender_name=self.sender_name,
            session_id=self.session_id,
        )
        if (
            self.session_id
            and isinstance(message, Message)
            and isinstance(message.text, str)
            and self.should_store_message
        ):
            store_message(
                message,
                flow_id=self.graph.flow_id,
            )
            self.message.value = message

        self.status = message
        return message
code.name: code

data_template.name: data_template
data_template.info: Template to convert Data to Text. If left empty, it will be dynamically set to the Data's text key.

input_value.name: input_value
input_value.info: Message to be passed as output.

session_id.name: session_id
session_id.info: The session ID of the chat. If empty, the current session ID parameter will be used.

should_store_message.name: should_store_message
should_store_message.info: Store the message in the history.

code.value:
from axiestudio.base.data.utils import IMG_FILE_TYPES, TEXT_FILE_TYPES
from axiestudio.base.io.chat import ChatComponent
from axiestudio.inputs import BoolInput
from axiestudio.io import DropdownInput, FileInput, MessageTextInput, MultilineInput, Output
from axiestudio.memory import store_message
from axiestudio.schema.message import Message
from axiestudio.utils.constants import MESSAGE_SENDER_AI, MESSAGE_SENDER_USER, MESSAGE_SENDER_NAME_USER


class ChatInput(ChatComponent):
    display_name = "Chat Input"
    description = "Get chat inputs from the Playground."
    icon = "ChatInput"
    name = "ChatInput"

    inputs = [
        MultilineInput(
            name="input_value",
            display_name="Text",
            value="",
            info="Message to be passed as input.",
        ),
        BoolInput(
            name="should_store_message",
            display_name="Store Messages",
            info="Store the message in the history.",
            value=True,
            advanced=True,
        ),
        DropdownInput(
            name="sender",
            display_name="Sender Type",
            options=[MESSAGE_SENDER_AI, MESSAGE_SENDER_USER],
            value=MESSAGE_SENDER_USER,
            info="Type of sender.",
            advanced=True,
        ),
        MessageTextInput(
            name="sender_name",
            display_name="Sender Name",
            info="Name of the sender.",
            value=MESSAGE_SENDER_NAME_USER,
            advanced=True,
        ),
        MessageTextInput(
            name="session_id",
            display_name="Session ID",
            info="The session ID of the chat. If empty, the current session ID parameter will be used.",
            advanced=True,
        ),
        FileInput(
            name="files",
            display_name="Files",
            file_types=TEXT_FILE_TYPES + IMG_FILE_TYPES,
            info="Files to be sent with the message.",
            advanced=True,
            is_list=True,
        ),
    ]
    outputs = [
        Output(display_name="Message", name="message", method="message_response"),
    ]

    def message_response(self) -> Message:
        message = Message(
            text=self.input_value,
            sender=self.sender,
            sender_name=self.sender_name,
            session_id=self.session_id,
            files=self.files,
        )

        if (
            self.session_id
            and isinstance(message, Message)
            and isinstance(message.text, str)
            and self.should_store_message
        ):
            store_message(
                message,
                flow_id=self.graph.flow_id,
            )
            self.message.value = message

        self.status = message
        return message
code.name: code

input_value.name: input_value
input_value.value: Quem foi o primeiro presidente do Brasil?
input_value.info: Message to be passed as input.

session_id.name: session_id
session_id.info: The session ID of the chat. If empty, the current session ID parameter will be used.

should_store_message.name: should_store_message
should_store_message.info: Store the message in the history.

from axiestudio.base.data.utils import IMG_FILE_TYPES, TEXT_FILE_TYPES
from axiestudio.base.io.chat import ChatComponent
from axiestudio.inputs import BoolInput
from axiestudio.io import DropdownInput, FileInput, MessageTextInput, MultilineInput, Output
from axiestudio.memory import store_message
from axiestudio.schema.message import Message
from axiestudio.utils.constants import MESSAGE_SENDER_AI, MESSAGE_SENDER_USER, MESSAGE_SENDER_NAME_USER


class ChatInput(ChatComponent):
    display_name = "Chat Input"
    description = "Get chat inputs from the Playground."
    icon = "ChatInput"
    name = "ChatInput"

    inputs = [
        MultilineInput(
            name="input_value",
            display_name="Text",
            value="",
            info="Message to be passed as input.",
        ),
        BoolInput(
            name="should_store_message",
            display_name="Store Messages",
            info="Store the message in the history.",
            value=True,
            advanced=True,

            name="sender",
            display_name="Sender Type",
            options=[MESSAGE_SENDER_AI, MESSAGE_SENDER_USER],

    outputs = [
